radiographic_examinations.findings: A ring-enhancing mass, measuring 8 mm by 9 mm, in the right parietal lobe of the brain.
An enhancing, lobulated mass in the right lower lobe of the lung, consistent with an arteriovenous malformation.

An enhancing lesion, 1.9 cm by 2.2 cm by 2.8 cm, in the right posterior cingulate gyrus with surrounding T2-weighted signal hyperintensity within the left posterior frontal and parietal lobes. Ring enhancement noted after contrast administration.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Marked enlargement from the initial study, nearly doubling in size during a period of 30 hours.

radiographic_examinations.findings: A hyperintense central area corresponding to restricted diffusion.
Increased mean transit time within the lesion and decreased cerebral blood volume.
